name: Mount Madison

trails_config.name: Valley Way Trail
trails_config.description: The standard approach to Madison Spring Hut. A well-graded, sheltered trail through the boreal forest leading to the rocky alpine summit.

trails_config.name: Madison Gulf Trail
trails_config.description: A rugged 'Terrifying 25' route through the remote Madison Gulf. Features a steep headwall with difficult footing and mossy slabs.
trails_config.parking_info: Pinkham Notch Visitor Center, NH-16, Gorham, NH

current_conditions.ai_summary: One of New Hampshire's premier peaks, Mount Madison rises to 5367 feet. It is known for its rugged terrain and panoramic vistas.
risk_factors: Check local trail conditions before departing.
Start early to avoid afternoon storms.

generated_description:
The Experience

Standing at 5367 feet, Mount Madison is a standout peak in New Hampshire. Known for its rugged and challenging terrain, it offers a quintessential hiking experience.

The Challenge

Hikers often choose the **Valley Way Trail**, a **7.6 mile** route gaining significant elevation. As part of the **NH48 4000-Footers**, it draws peak-baggers from across the region.

Peak Bagging Logic

**Peak Bagging Opportunity:** Consider connecting this hike with **Mount Adams**, which is just 0.9 miles away. Linking these peaks is a popular way to maximize your day on the trail.
